MC_Halt_SML (FB)
MC_Halt_SML (FB)
Â¶
FUNCTION_BLOCK FINAL MC_Halt_SML
Commands a controlled motion stop.
The axis is moved to the state
DiscreteMotion
, until the velocity is zero.
When the output
Done
is set, the state is transferred to
Standstill
.
Note
MC_Halt_SML
is used to stop the axis under normal operation conditions.
It is possible to start another motion command during deceleration of the axis,
which will abort
MC_Halt_SML
and will be executed immediately.
The example below shows the behavior in combination with
MC_MoveVelocity_SML
.
A rotating axis is ramped down with Function Block
MC_Halt_SML
Another motion command overrides the
MC_Halt_SML
command.
MC_Halt_SML
allows this, in contrast to
MC_Stop_SML
.
The axis can accelerate again without reaching
Standstill
.
